DataElement.preferredName: Early Intervention Therapeutic Procedure Administered Location Therapeutic Procedure Type Location
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._A range of targeted services and supports that are available to babies and young children with developmental delays or specific health conditions._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._Medical care given to a patient to mitigate or cure an illness, injury, or reduced health status. NOTE: May include prescribed drugs, biologics, surgery, devices, and physical or psychotherapies, but not diagnostics or prophylaxis. See also intervention, diagnosis._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.
